description: Originally a variant spelling and pronunciation of inhuman, ultimately from Latin inhūmānus; it appears to have died out 17c. but returned c. 1822, probably a reformation as a negative of humane.

adjectives.description: inhumane (comparative more inhumane, superlative most inhumane)

entries.meaning: Alternative form of inhuman: lacking pity or compassion for misery and suffering; cruel, unkind.
